ALLEGATION:
It is alleged that the agency is not reporting restraint incident reports to the MDHHS-
DCWL mailbox.
It is alleged that the agency is not submitting to DCWL a requested spreadsheet to
enable the department to complete agency staff Central registry clearances.
INVESTIGATION:
On December 2, 2020, a special investigation was initiated into the allegations
described above. Staff interviews were conducted on site and documents were
reviewed. What follows is information obtained from the aforementioned sources.
2

On December 7, 2020, the agency Chief Administrator was interviewed. The Chief
Administrator acknowledged that the agency was not submitting restraint incident
reports to the MDHHS-DCWL mailbox. The Chief Administrator stated that this
responsibility had been delegated to the agency Behavioral Program Supervisor.
The Chief Administrator acknowledged that he had not been monitoring submission
of the incident reports to ensure they were being submitted. I provided a copy of
Communication Issuance 20-095 dated July 23, 2020. The Chief Administrator
acknowledged that he had received the issuance and was aware of the
requirements.
Regarding the submission of the agency staff information spreadsheet to DCWL he
acknowledged that he was unaware of the November 9, 2020 email from DCWL
requesting that the information be provided and submitted to DCWL within 7 days.
The Chief Administrator reported that the email had gone to the Pineview Homes
email address and not his email, so he was unaware of the request until a December
2, 2020, email from DCWL which was sent directly to his email. The Chief
Administrator acknowledged that the agency had not completed and submitted the
information within 7 days.
On December 7, 2020, Staff 1, the Behavioral Program Supervisor, was interviewed.
Staff 1 reported that he was given the responsibility of submitting restraint incident
reports to MDHHS-DCWL. Staff 1 reported that he initially had been unable to work
in MISACWIS and so a staff person no longer with the agency was given the
responsibility to upload incident reports and submit them to MDHHS-DCWL. Staff 1
acknowledged that he and the former staff forgot to submit the reports to the
department.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4116 Chief administrator; responsibilities.
(1) An agency shall assign the chief administrator
responsibility for the on-site day-to-day operation of the
institution and for ensuring compliance with these rules.
ANALYSIS: The Chief Administrator and Staff 1 acknowledged that incident
reports were not submitted as required.
The Chief Administrator acknowledged that the requested data
spreadsheet was not completed and returned to DCWL within 7
days.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
3

ALLEGATION:
It is alleged that the agency is not reporting to DCWL facility staff and resident
COVID positive test results.
INVESTIGATION:
During the December 7, 2020, interview with the Chief Administrator he
acknowledged that the agency had not been reporting COVID positive results for
staff and residents to DCWL, as required by Communication Issuance 20-061, dated
August 17, 2020. The Chief Administrator reported that he did not recall the
Communication Issuance. The Chief Administrator reported that in November 2020,
two staff had tested positive and this was not reported to DCWL.
On December 7, 2020, agency Staff 2, the Health Services Supervisor was briefly
interviewed. Staff 2 reported that she was not aware of the reporting procedures as
required by the Communication Issuance. Staff 2 reported that she is responsible for
the agency’s response to COVID cases and monitoring staff and resident health.
Staff 2 submitted the names of the two staff who tested positive and corresponding
dates of illness.
DOCUMENT REVIEW: A review of COVID cases was conducted as provided in the
document submitted by Staff 2. The agency had two staff test positive for COVID in
November 2020.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4151 Emergency; continuity of operation procedures.
(2) The procedures shall explain, in detail, all of the
following:
(c) Required notifications, including but not limited to,
the licensing authority, the referring agency, and law
enforcement.
ANALYSIS: The agency failed to report COVID positive cases to DCWL as
required by Communication Issuance 20-061.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
4
